final_answer.precision_note: 3 s.f. from 3 s.f. data using concentration dilution relation.

method: Apply the dilution equation c1V1 = c2V2. Convert 25.0 cm3 and 250.0 cm3 to dm3: V1 = 0.0250 dm3 and V2 = 0.250 dm3. Initial moles are c1V1 = 0.200 × 0.0250 = 5.00 × 10^-3 mol. Final concentration is c2 = n / V2 = 5.00 × 10^-3 / 0.250 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: Volume increases tenfold from 25.0 to 250.0 cm3, so concentration decreases to about one-tenth.
Initial and final moles match: 0.200 × 25.0 = 5.00 and 0.0200 × 250.0 = 5.00 (cmol equivalent).
